{"step_by_step_thinking": "Nausea and vomiting postoperatively can be caused by a variety of factors. Blood ingested during surgery can cause nausea and vomiting as the body tries to expel it. Nitrous oxide (N2O) is a common anesthetic used during surgery, and one of its side effects can be nausea and vomiting. Opioids are often used for pain management post-surgery, and they are well-known to cause nausea and vomiting as a side effect. Acetaminophen, on the other hand, is not typically associated with causing nausea and vomiting postoperatively.", "answer_choice": "D. Acetaminophen"}
